original:
For a plant to exhibit a short stature, it must be homozygous for the recessive allele. This genetic concept can be effectively illustrated using a Punnett square. In a Punnett square, the genotypes of the parent plants are placed along the top and side of the grid. Typically, an uppercase letter represents the dominant allele, while a lowercase letter denotes the recessive allele.
